_comment: Minecraft NeoForge server egg for Pterodactyl
name: Minecraft - NeoForge
author: OpenAI Assistant
description: Installs and runs a Minecraft server using the NeoForge modding platform on Linux.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e
cd /mnt/server

MINECRAFT_VERSION="${MINECRAFT_VERSION:-1.20.1}"
NEOFORGE_VERSION="${NEOFORGE_VERSION:-20.4.139-beta}"
INSTALLER_URL="https://maven.neoforged.net/releases/net/neoforged/neoforge/${NEOFORGE_VERSION}/neoforge-${NEOFORGE_VERSION}-installer.jar"
INSTALLER_FILE="neoforge-${NEOFORGE_VERSION}-installer.jar"

echo "Downloading NeoForge ${NEOFORGE_VERSION} for Minecraft ${MINECRAFT_VERSION}..."
curl -fSL -o "${INSTALLER_FILE}" "${INSTALLER_URL}"

echo "Running NeoForge installer..."
java -jar "${INSTALLER_FILE}" --installServer

echo "Cleaning up installer..."
rm -f "${INSTALLER_FILE}"

DEFAULT_JAR="neoforge-${NEOFORGE_VERSION}-universal.jar"
FOUND_JAR=$(find . -maxdepth 1 -type f -name "neoforge-*universal.jar" | head -n 1)
if [[ -n "${FOUND_JAR}" && ! -f "${DEFAULT_JAR}" ]]; then
  mv "${FOUND_JAR}" "${DEFAULT_JAR}"
fi

if [[ -n "${SERVER_JARFILE}" && "${SERVER_JARFILE}" != "${DEFAULT_JAR}" ]]; then
  mv -f "${DEFAULT_JAR}" "${SERVER_JARFILE}"
else
  export SERVER_JARFILE="${DEFAULT_JAR}"
fi

if [[ ! -f eula.txt ]]; then
  echo "eula=true" > eula.txt
fi

rm -f run.sh run.bat

variables.name: Minecraft Version
variables.description: Version of Minecraft the server will target.

variables.name: NeoForge Version
variables.description: NeoForge build to install (must exist on the NeoForged Maven repository).

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: Name of the jar the panel will run. Usually the generated universal jar.
